q: One of the CIA's victims was Mamdouh Habib , an Egyptian-born Australian citizen. U.S. agents bought him from Pakistani intelligence and shipped him to Egypt. ''In Egypt,'' reports Lisa Hajjar for Al Jazeera, he was repeatedly subjected to electric shocks, immersed in water up to his nostrils and beaten. His fingers were broken and he was hung from metal hooks. At one point, his interrogator slapped him so hard that his blindfold was dislodged, revealing the identity of his tormentor: Omar Suleiman . Frustrated that Mamdouh Habib was not providing useful information or confessing to involvement in terrorism, Omar Suleiman ordered a guard to murder a shackled prisoner in front of Mamdouh Habib , which he did with a vicious karate kick. Ibn al-Sheikh al-Libi was a former trainer in the Afghan jihadi camps who famously ''confessed'' a connection between Saddam and Al Qaeda while under torture in one of Omar Suleiman 's dungeons. I think one year of surge has produced rather inconclusive results, Colin Powell said. ''I can not tell whether or not the surge is successful.''-- With assistance from Mike Dorning in Washington. It's frustrating that it's taking so long for my game to come back. But by being in the league eight years, I've been through struggles and I know how to play while struggling.
